result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamale A. Bonds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Victim List

Defendant Jamale A. Bonds in court with attorney Tina M Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Jamale A. Bonds in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  16CF57, 16CF241, 17CF158, 17CM101, 18CF148 called at 9:15 a.m.  Statement by DA.  Will only be proceeding with sentencing after revocation cases 16CF57 & 16CF241.   16CF57 credit for 217 days and 16CF241 235 days.  Revocation packet received and reviewed.  No corrections.  16CF57 Ct 1- 18 mo IC /6 mo EC  and Ct 2 & 3 recommendations.  16CF241 Ct 2 - 2 yrs IC & 2 yr ES.  State presents sentencing arguments.   Atty Abernethy-May presents sentencing arguments, requesting time served.   Statement by def.  Sentencing remarks by court.  Court orders 16CF57 Ct 1 -1 yr county jail  outstanding court obligation civil jmt  217 days credit.   Ct 2- 2 yr IC & 2 ES  and Ct 3 - 2 yrs IC & 2 yr ES  Concurrent.   16CF241 Ct 2 2 yrs IC & 2 yrs. EC Credit 235 days.   Concurrent.   All outstanding obligations converted to civil judgment.   Post convictions.  State has complied with victim rights.   Atty Abernethy-May request  program.   Court will allow substance abuse program, DOC may not agree. Other cases are set.  17CF158 is set for preliminary hearing   and 17CM101 & 18CF148 will follow as status conf.

Defendant Jamale A. Bonds in court with attorney Tina M Abernethy-Mays.  Defendant Jamale A. Bonds in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 17CF158, 17CM101 and 18CF148, 16CF57, 16CF241 @ 11:12 a.m. 17CF158 and 17CM101 were scheduled for plea/sentencing. Court was advised that matters are not resolved. State advises that sentence after revocation on 16CF57 and 16CF241 needs to be scheduled. 11:14 off the record for scheduling. Back on the record 11:17.
16CF57 and 16CF241 SAR on 7/19/18 @ 9:00 a.m. Other cases status at same time.  17CF158 prelim hrg 8/22/18 @ 10:00 a.m.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2018 at 09:00 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2018 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jamale A. Bonds in court with attorney Tina M Abernethy-Mays.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF214, 16CF57 and 16CF241 @ 4:09 p.m. Agreement stated - 16CF241 State moves to dismiss and read in ct 1, Def will plead to ct 2, dismiss and read in ct 3. 16CF57 - Def will plead to cts 1, 2 & 3.  15CF214 dismiss and read in ct 2, plead to ct 1. Withheld sentence, 12 months probation on each, concurrent to each other, costs, DNA surcharge, no contact with S.S., domestic abuse assessment and follow through, absolute sobreity, no presence in any place with class B liquor license, counseling deemed necessary. State has complied with VWNR. Atty Abernethy-Mays and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed.  Pleas - 16CF57 ct 1 - no contest, ct 2 - no contest, ct 3 - no contest. 15CF214 ct 1 - no contest. 16CF241 ct 2 - no contest. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in 15CF214 ct 2, 16CF241 cts 1 & 3. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Abernethy-Mays satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 16CF57 cts 1, 2, and 3, 15CF214 ct 1, 16CF241 ct 2. State gives sentence credit of 18 days in 16CF241 and 76 days in 15CF214 if revoked. Sentencing remarks by counsel. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement.  On each ct - Sentence withheld, 12 months probation, concurrent, court costs, DNA surcharge, no contact w/S.S., domestic abuse assessment and follow through, no presence in places with class B liquor lic., maintain sobriety, any counseling deemed appropriate. State does not object to bonds being applied. Court orders all bonds applied to costs. 16CF241 - 18 days credit if revoked. 15CF214 - 76 days credit if revoked. 16CF57 - no credit if revoked. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. DNA sample already submitted.

Final pre-trial on February 20, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on March 8, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on December 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jamale A. Bonds in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF214 and 16CF57 @ 11:10 a.m. State's motion for joinder and State's motion to allow other acts. Parties agree to allow joinder. Court grants motion upon stipulation of parties. Cases will be tried together. State gives arguments on motion to allow other acts. Response by Atty Abernethy-Mays. Rebuttal by State. Nothing further by Atty Abernethy-Mays. Recess 11:26 Resume 11:29. Court has reviewed statute and State vs Sullivan and gives ruling. Motion granted. Off the record for scheduling @ 11:46 Back on record 11:50 - Motions in limine to be filed before final pretrial if possible, but no later. Def must appear.  Jury trial scheduled for December 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on August 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jamale A. Bonds in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls  @ 8:43 am.  Waiver of preliminary examination filed. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause & binds over. Information Filed.  Atty Abernethy-Mays has copy of information, waives reading, reserve rights & enters Not Guilty plea to all ct's.  Court receives Not Guilty plea and directs Clerk to enter. Bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
No contact at all with S. S.

Defendant Jamale A. Bonds in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received and reviewed.  State gives recommendations for bond.  15CF214 State moves to forfeit this bond and request another $500.00 cash.  Response by Atty Abernethy-Mays.  Rebuttal.  Court will order bond 15CF214 forfeited pending hearing.   Court questions if def can post any bond.  Def indicates that he can not post any cash bond.  Bond set by court.  Timely preliminary hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
